summary_of_threads_started_this_week:
Jaonoctus has launched a new resource for the Bitcoin community, inspired by the prunednode.today project initiated by stepansnigirev/Specter, offering access to AssumeUTXO files and Bitcoin blockchain snapshots through a dedicated website. This platform is designed to support developers and researchers by providing essential data and technical details necessary for engaging with Bitcoin's infrastructure, making it easier to understand and work with the Bitcoin blockchain without the need for downloading the entire chain. The website, which can be found at [https://bitcoin-snapshots.jaonoctus.dev](https://bitcoin-snapshots.jaonoctus.dev), includes technical information and results from the `gettxoutsetinfo` command, alongside specific AssumeUTXO parameters crucial for verifying the authenticity and accuracy of the provided data, further details of which are available on the Bitcoin GitHub repository at [https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/32efe850438ef22e2de39e562af557872a402c31/src/kernel/chainparams.cppL497-L504](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/32efe850438ef22e2de39e562af557872a402c31/src/kernel/chainparams.cppL497-L504).

This initiative emphasizes the significance of community-driven projects in enhancing the functionality and accessibility of the Bitcoin ecosystem, contributing to its broader objectives of decentralization. By facilitating easier access to critical Bitcoin blockchain data and snapshots, the project aids practical operations within the Bitcoin network and supports ongoing development and research efforts. The effort showcases a significant step towards bolstering the infrastructure necessary for the growth and sustainability of cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin.

new_threads_this_week.title: AssumeUTXO and Bitcoin snapshots
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- AssumeUTXO and Bitcoin blockchain snapshots are now available on a dedicated website.
- The site offers detailed technical info for verifying data authenticity and accuracy.
- This initiative supports Bitcoin's infrastructure and promotes decentralization and accessibility.

active_posts_this_week.title: P2QRH / BIP-360 Update
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- FALCON+ is nearing NIST approval, improving on security with minimal cost and no data overhead.
- Despite no attacks on Bitcoin's SECP256k1, emerging weaknesses suggest a cautious approach to new algorithms like FALON+.
- The push for quantum-safe standards in Bitcoin is urgent, with 2027 as a critical deadline.

active_posts_this_week.title: Update on the Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Antoine Poinsot raises concerns about affordable mining hardware's performance in Bitcoin discussions.
- Successful outcomes noted with parallelization in 4 and 8 core configurations.
- Inquiry into performance under constrained conditions suggests interest in hardware robustness.

active_posts_this_week.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The document investigates 64-byte Bitcoin transactions, their structure, and limitations.
- It discusses how these transactions lack capacity for secure digital signatures and Script outputs.
- A proposed BIP aims to make such transactions consensus-invalid to enhance network security.

active_posts_this_week.title: ZK-gossip for lightning channel announcements
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- A novel ZK proofs method enhances LN privacy without altering the framework significantly.
- This technique involves a Musig2 key, a blinding value, and a hashed beta for privacy.
- An implementation reduces proving time to 16-22 seconds, promising improved LN efficiency and security.

active_posts_this_week.title: Fastest-possible PoW via Simple DAG
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Analysis of PoW DAG blockchain shows network topology affects block creation fairness.
- The "Nc/Nb" method measures DAG width, adjusting block time to network latency, enhancing equity.
- This approach aims to support smaller miners, addressing inequality in block rewards distribution.

active_posts_this_week.title: Antoine Poinsot on Bitcoin Core's Priorities
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Discussion suggests refocusing software on node components, splitting it into multiprocess binaries.
- Bitcoin Development Kit shifts towards self-contained methodologies for transaction management.
- Proposes using separate tools for wallet functionalities, enhancing efficiency and ecosystem diversity.

active_posts_this_week.title: CVE-2024-38365 public disclosure (btcd `FindAndDelete` bug)
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The document details a Bitcoin Core unit test important for generating specific transactions.
- The author is cautious about public sharing, fearing misuse by those with malicious intent.
- After five months, there's consideration to release the information, balancing openness and risk.
